meanings.definition: Beat or hit (someone) with a sjambok.
meanings.sent1: The angry farmer was sjamboking the ground to scare away the birds.
meanings.sent2: The trainer was sjamboking the punching bag to demonstrate proper technique.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to be sjamboking the invisible monsters in the room.
meanings.sent4: The storm was sjamboking the trees with its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of sjamboking echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: A long, heavy whip typically made of animal hide.
meanings.sent1: The explorer carried a sjamboking for protection in the wild.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper used a sjamboking to gently guide the elephants.
meanings.sent3: The circus performer playfully cracked the sjamboking in the air.
meanings.sent4: The cowboy's sjamboking gleamed in the sunlight as he rode into town.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the sjamboking striking the ground signaled the start of the race.
